‚è∞ Less time on congested roads

The #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw is a win-win for all, and I am committed to working with local stakeholders to ensure that our community receives its fair share of resources and every city can successfully draw down the funds available to meet their infrastructure priorities.
In total, these infrastructure investments will improve the quality of life in our communities, while creating good-paying jobs, boosting our economy, and addressing the climate crisis.
These investments will drive demand for zero-emission, cleaner vehicles and makes our country go more greener than ever.

To address air pollution that disproportionately impacts our most vulnerable communities, the law invests $7.5 billion in clean school buses and ferries and $7.5 billion for electric vehicle charging infrastructure.

The law also delivers clean and safe drinking water to families across the country and invests $55 billion in water infrastructure, including over $23 billion for drinking and wastewater infrastructure and $15 billion for the replacement of lead pipes.

The #BipartisanInfrastructureLaw ensures every American has access to reliable and affordable high-speed internet. The new law invests $65 billion in broadband infrastructure, which is all the more critical especially now during the pandemic.

Funding highlights include:
$110B for roads and bridges
$66B for passenger and freight rail
$11B for highway and pedestrian safety
$39B for transit systems, incl. increasing accessibility for seniors and people with disabilities
$17B for our ports and harbors
and so much more!

This historic legislation will be crucial to growing our local and national economies and helping our communities plan their growth, connect our cities, and significantly improve safety along our roads, bridges, public transit, and rail systems.
